physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Acute onset severe headache, dizziness, vomiting, right-sided weakness (more intensive in his arm), visual alterations, impaired verbal expression.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Neurologic symptoms improved gradually and disappeared completely after 3 days.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Brain MRI showed no significant findings.
Decreased 99mTc-HMPAO activity in the left parieto-occipital cortex during the aura phase.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Second SPECT four days later showed normal regional cerebral blood flow when no neurological symptoms were observed.
